content: finished on the right side then the project should be turned inside out on that you are creating the seam on the inside of the hood divide the stitches in half if you decreased six times there should be 45 stitches left on the needles if working with straight needles divide 23 onto needle one and 22 on needle two if working with circular needles just pull the the loop through the middle of the of the stitches bringing them to the front of each needle visualize each side as needle one and needle two does not matter which is which this three needle bind off method involves knitting the first stitch from needle one and needle two together onto needle three then knit the second stitches from needle one and needle two together onto needle three and the cast off happens by knitting together the two stitches on needle three proceed with knitting the third stitch from needle one and two together onto needle three and again knit the two new stitches together on needle three there should now be 1 stitch on needle 3 20 stitches on needle one and 19 stitches on needle two if you have problems understanding elizabeth smith knits does a good tutorial https //elizabethsmithknits com/techniques/three-needle-bind-off/ repeat this until there is one stitch left on needle one and needle three then knit the two stitches together and pull the yarn through part two now for the face shaping using the same sized needles pick up all the slipped stitches surrounding the face opening including the ones placed on the hold at the top of the neck make sure you have an even number knit one purl one in the round until the ribbing reaches 8 cm the ribbing is designed to be doubled up thus it is folded using the same technique as the closing on the top turn the hood inside out pick up the stitches along the bottom of the ribbing and knit the first together knit the second together and knit though both of these to create the stretchy bind off repeat until you cast off the last of the stitches then pull the yarn though the final stitch and pull it closed part three note if the mohair you are using will cause irritation stop using it half way so that the yarn in contact with your neck is not irritating for the ribbing around the neck pick the stitches along the bottom of the hood making sure to have an even number again work in a knit one purl one ribbing until the neck reaches 15 cm or until you are almost out of yarn then turn the hood inside out fold over the ribbing and bind it off using the three needles bind off method which again involves picking up the stitches from the base of the ribbing and knitting them together be careful not to twist the ribbing sew in the ends when you are done and
